capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's incredible to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world from birth just because of a lightning-shaped scar on your forehead? It's no wonder he had so many enemies, but also so many friends who stood by him.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. who is the boy that lived?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm a huge fan of Professor McGonagall. I mean, she's an amazing witch and an incredible role model for any young witch or wizard. Her lineage is indeed pure-blood, and that's something to be proud of. But what I admire most about her is the way she balances being a member of the noble pure-blood families with her strong sense of justice and fairness. She's truly a remarkable woman.
